title: Skip the Store-Bought Stuff and Make Your Own Gourmet Popcorn at Home
full_text:
Skip the Store-Bought Stuff and Make Your Own Gourmet Popcorn at Home
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
0 mins
Cook
2 mins
Total
2 mins
Serves
4 servings
Makes
1 Bag of Popcorn
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
1/2
cup
popcorn kernels
1/2
teaspoon
canola or
vegetable oil
Kosher salt,
to taste
Directions
In a small mixing bowl, add combine popcorn kernels, oil, and salt. Toss well until kernels are evenly coated in oil.
Serious Eats / Daniel Gritzer
Transfer popcorn kernels to a clean brown paper lunch bag. Evenly fold top of bag over by approximately 1.5 inches and then fold each of the top corners of the bag over diagonally. Tear a small tab out of the center of each diagonal fold, and then fold that over as well. This prevents the bag from opening as the popcorn expands.
Serious Eats / Daniel Gritzer
Place the kernel-filled brown paper bag in the microwave and run on high for about 2 minutes, watching carefully the entire time to ensure the bag doesn't smolder or, worse, catch fire. The exact timing will vary depending on the microwave, so be sure to err a little on the un-popped side of things to avoid scorching and burning the popcorn. Serve.
Serious Eats / Daniel Gritzer
Special Equipment
Brown paper lunch bag, microwave
Notes
As noted at the start of this recipe, brown paper bags are not necessarily designed to be microwave-safe. Watch the whole time when microwaving your popcorn, and if in doubt, it's better to err on the side of leaving some kernels unpopped rather than trying to pop every last one.
